message.content:
cs.NA, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of approximating a single component of the solution to a system of linear equations, which is a common problem in numerical analysis (cs.NA). The algorithms presented in the paper rely on sparsity of the matrix and use local and asynchronous updates, which are topics in distributed computing (cs.DS) and parallel computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses convergence guarantees and error bounds, which are topics in control theory (cs.SY) and machine learning (cs.LG).
